723518f-a.text:
Thompson Street, east side, north from West 3rd (formerly Amity) Street, with Washington Square and the One Fifth Avenue apartment hotel in the background. An outdoor art exhibition is going on; the drawings and paintings are hung along the fence of the vacant lot where 240 to 248 Thompson Street stood till about 1928.
November 17, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

730559f-b.title: Artists and poets - Greenwich Village.
730559f-b.text:
(1) The outdoor Art Exhibition in Greenwich Village, north from West 3rd Street, along Thompson Street; also showing Washington Arch and Fifth Ave.
May 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a slightly different angle.
May 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
730559f-b.folder: 3rd Street (West) and Thompson Street , Manhattan, N.Y.

710878f-a.text:
View 1:
3rd Street, west fro Thompson Street, showing Pinto's Dancing Academy on corner and Bertollies
Cafe on opposite side of Street.
May 19, 1939.
View 2:
West 3rd Street, southside and east from Sullivan to Thompson Street, showing the well known Cafes El Gaucho and the Bowling Alley.
May 19, 1939.
View 3;
Same.
P.L.Speer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS May 19, 1939.
